intro: Paullinia dasystachya f. hirta, commonly known as the hairy stamen paullinia, is a variant of the species native to the rainforests of South America. It is characterized by its hairy stamens, which distinguish it from other members of the genus. The plant typically grows as an evergreen shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to several meters. Its leaves are alternate, elliptical, and often have a glossy surface. The flowers are small and clustered, producing a unique ornamental appearance that makes it a subject of botanical interest.
